review: I use this all the time.  Big Youtube/Netflix consumer and have my laptop next to my couch at all time.  Buffers are solid as long as you have a good service.  Our Charter maintains at a consistent 20 so only a rare hiccup in buffering.  Set up was very simple on my laptop and cell.  When not being used the backdrop changes scenes (to prevent dreaded burn-in images) every minute or so, drawing from G+ I think.  Almost doubles as hanging wall art with a little, digital clock in the lower right corner.The only con would be if you're going to use it to cast (aka mirror) your desktop.  There's about a 5-15s lag when used (I think this feature is still in beta). You can cast the desktop or just one tab.  Not really worth it and have only tried a couple of times.  Since it's only in beta maybe it will improve over time.  Otherwise just get an HDMI cable which should only set you back $5-$50 depending on how long of a cable you need (don't be a chump and buy the high-end brand, lookin at you monster cables).
